noun.name: train
noun.discription: a long vehicle with multiple carriages designed for transporting passengers or goods along tracks

object1.name: airplane
object1.discription: in parallel with 'train', is a powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and one or more engines, designed for air travel

object2.name: ship
object2.discription: in parallel with 'train', is a large watercraft designed for deep-sea navigation and transport of goods or passengers

object3.name: bus
object3.discription: in parallel with 'train', is a large road vehicle designed to carry passengers, typically on urban and suburban routes

object4.name: bicycle
object4.discription: in parallel with 'train', is a two-wheeled, human-powered vehicle used for personal transportation

object5.name: helicopter
object5.discription: in parallel with 'train', is a rotorcraft with horizontally spinning rotors providing lift and thrust for vertical flight

object6.name: submarine
object6.discription: in parallel with 'train', is a watercraft capable of independent operation underwater, used for naval warfare or research

object7.name: rocket
object7.discription: in parallel with 'train', is a vehicle or missile that obtains thrust by the reaction of the rocket engine

object8.name: tram
object8.discription: in parallel with 'train', is a rail vehicle which runs on tracks along public urban streets and also sometimes on separate rights of way
